column2: NORTH DAKOTA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 2. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must call the police.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column10: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 4. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column8: never take precedence over

column2: 5. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 6. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column10: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 8. Drivers must not drive at:
column4: a speed that is greater than the posted speed limit.
column6: a speed that is greater than reasonable.
column8: a speed that is not prudent for the circumstances.

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 10. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column8: at roundabouts.

column2: 11. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column6: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.
column8: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column10: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.

column2: 12. You are driving on a four-lane divided highway, two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of you, and you are in a hurry. You should:
column4: drive in either lane with at least a two-second time interval behind the vehicle ahead.
column6: drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
column8: drive closely behind the vehicles ahead changing lanes frequently.
column10: drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway begins

column2: 14. Increasing your vehicle’s speed _____ your field of vision.
column8: has no effect on

column2: 15. Alcohol:
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column10: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 16. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column8: accelerate much faster

column2: 17. Aggressive drivers:
column8: tailgate other vehicles and make improper lane changes.

column2: 18. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Leave the road immediately.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 19. When you are involved in an accident and your vehicle is blocking traffic, you should:
column4: wait for the police to arrive before moving your vehicle.
column6: not move your vehicle under any circumstances.
column8: move your vehicle off of the travelled portion of the roadway, if possible.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution
column8: Yield right-of-way

column2: 21. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column10: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.

column2: 22. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: slow down until it passes you.
column8: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column10: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.

column2: 23. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: green; white

column2: 24. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column8: One-way street
